description: '''Beatdown hardcore''' (also known as '''heavy hardcore''', '''brutal hardcore''', '''moshcore''', or simply '''beatdown''') is a subgenre of [[hardcore punk]] which incorporates elements of [[thrash metal]] and [[hip hop music|hip hop]]. The genre features aggressive vocals, heavy, [[palm muted]] guitar riffs and [[breakdown (music)#Heavy metal and punk rock|breakdowns]]. The genre has its origins in late 1980s [[tough guy hardcore]] bands such as [[Breakdown (band)|Breakdown]], [[Killing Time (American band)|Killing Time]], and [[Madball]], and was pioneered in the mid-1990s by bands like [[Bulldoze (band)|Bulldoze]], Terror Zone, and [[Neglect (band) |Neglect]]. The definition of the genre has expanded over time to incorporate artists increasingly indebted to metal, notably [[Xibalba (band)|Xibalba]], [[Sunami (band)|Sunami]], and [[Knocked Loose]]. Later acts also feature [[slam death metal]] riffs.
